abstracts.cdata!:
The Report and Recommendation of the
            Inspection Panel for the Yacyreta Hydroelectric Project in
            Argentina and Brazil outlines the concerns of the
            Requesters, an organization called Sobrevivenca,
            representing the people of Encarnacion, Paraguay.  The
            Requesters state that the environment and the standards of
            living have been compromised due to the filling of the
            reservoir for the hydroelectric project and that there was a
            lack of proper supervision in the environmental and
            resettlement activities. The Requesters allege that the
            filling of the reservoir caused the water to become to
            stagnant and polluted and contaminated the drinking water;
            affected sanitation in the area; destroyed crops; flooded
            farmlands; disrupted fish migration by damming the river.
            Social impacts included a loss of jobs, livelihood, and
            forced resettled to inadequate housing.  The Requesters also
            state that the Bank has been lax in their overall
            supervision of the project.  The Management Response replied
            to the claims, stating that the problems listed by the
            Requesters were not caused by the Bank's lack of
            supervision and that all environmental and resettlement
            activities had met certain criteria in order to be completed.
